string.text: Enemy spotted, %s!
Looks like we've got company to the %s.
Hostiles approaching from the %s!
Get down! Enemies to the %s!
Enemy in sight, %s!
Watch out! Hostiles to the %s!
There's someone over there, to the %s.
Mutants! To the %s!
Careful, there are some mutants over there, to the %s.
Look out! Mutants to the %s!
Shh... I hear something moving in those bushes to the %s.
Look, to the %s. What is that thing?
There's a couple of mutants to the %s. Let's go clear them out.
%s, help me! I'm wounded!
Help! I'm wounded!
I'm down! %s, help me!
%s! I need help!
Medic! I'm hit!
I'm finished... Go on without me.
I'm hurt! I need help!
Come back! I need your help!
I'm hit bad!
%s, help!
%s, can we slow down for a bit? I'm hurt pretty bad.
I could use some rest, I'm still injured.
I need to rest a little while, I got torn up pretty good back there.
Try to keep us out of trouble, %s. I'm still not fully healed from before.
Do you mind if we rest a little while, %s? I need to tend to my wounds.
I got hit pretty good back there. Hurts like a mother.
Damn, I got hurt bad back there.
These injuries are worse than I thought. I need to regain my strength.
Nice shot.
Damn %s, where'd you learn to shoot like that?
Whoa, nice kill.
That was impressive.
Jeez %s, remind me not to get on your bad side.
Good kill.
Well executed.
Watching you engage a target is like watching a ballet.
Nice.
That shut him up.
Damn you're good.
I never would have pulled that off in a million years.
Got him!
Eat shit! Eat my shit!
I got him!
One down.
He's dead.
Die you fucking piece of shit!
Boom.
Bet you didn't see me coming, did you, asshole?
Anyone else want some of this?
Fuck you!
Got it!
Killed one!
Take that you filthy mutant!
Fuck you, mutants!
Bagged it!
Ooh! Great shot if I do say so myself.
Die you fucking thing!
Argh, I got it's guts all over me.
Dead.
Another one down.
Damn I'm good.
Got that one!
This place gives me the creeps.
What do you think this place used to be?
This place is cool.
I wonder what used to go on in here.
This place is creepy, man.
I don't like this place.
It's freezing in here.
Did you hear that?
I thought I saw something moving in the shadows over there.
Something doesn't seem right with this place.
Check this place out.
Not afraid of the dark I hope.
Oh, we're about to get attacked by snorks, I just know it.
I hate this place.
Watch your step around here. Nearly twisted my ankle.
This place looks like it could collapse at any moment.
Sad thing is, I'm looking around here and thinking this place is so much cleaner than my apartment back home.
If we see any rats in here it's a good sign. It means there's nothing bigger in here that ate them.
What do you think they used to use this place for?
Ah, another fine example of 1980's Soviet architecture.
Have we been in this one before? All the buildings are starting to look the same to me.

I was sitting outside the other day, looking at a building, and it collapsed. No reason why, other than it being so old and neglected, just happened to be it's time. Something to think about while we're in here.
It is so damn cold in here.
Watch out for blind dogs. They tend to make their dens inside buildings.
Did you see that? This place is so dilapidated the leaves blow right through the walls.
I was here by myself once. I kept thinking I heard someone calling my name. It was really spooky.
What is this place?
I'm getting a really bad vibe from this place. It's like the building itself doesn't want us in here.
This place isn't bad; needs a litte paint, a couple curtains, maybe a rug... I could live here.
Did you see that calender back there? Still turned to April 1986. A place frozen in time.
Shhh! Did you hear that? I think there's someone in here.
What the fuck was that? Something just brushed up against my leg!
Did you notice there is not a single spider web in here?
Hey, a piece of gum from the 1980's... Mmm, still has some flavor, too.
I'm starting to notice some of the buildings around here look like they were re-purposed at some point after the 1986 accident, and not just by stalkers. I wonder what was going on in here?
Maybe this building houses the Wish Granter? You never know, this could be the one.
Hello... (hello)... (hello)... Nice echo.
How is it 30 degrees colder in here than it is outside?
I've got a bad feeling about this.
What is that? Is that an owl? Never seen an owl in the Zone before.
Hey, look at this; a porno mag from the 1980's... Jesus, I guess they didn't have razors back then.
Look in the corner there, that mouse trap still has cheese on it. All this time and it still hasn't caught one mouse.

You know Yuri Icepick, that guy that hangs out in Garbage? He says he never goes exploring inside buildings, he's worried about the lead paint. I mean, come on, of all the things that can kill you here in the Zone you're worried about lead paint?
This is how my first apartment was decorated.
I hate going into buildings alone. I swear, it's like you can feel the memories of those who inhabited it before. Ghosts are real, man.
Chilly in here.
Is that a snake?
Dimka Cornhusker was up this way not too long ago, word is he ran into a pack of blind dogs. I think we passed by part of him on the way in here.
I think there's something moving over there in the corner.
My feet are killing me.
Your boot's untied.
Beautiful out here, isn't it?
At least it's not raining...
Those crows always seem to be flying right above us. It's a miracle we haven't gotten crapped on yet.
I need to get some more antirads next time I'm at a trader.
*hic* Crap, I've got the hiccups.
I start to get nervous when it's this quiet.

I was camping out in the old mill in Cordon a while back, and I heard some commotion coming from near the train bridge. I could see it was some rookie Bandit trying to get his fat ass up the hill, but he kept slipping back down and dumping all his gear. He finally made it to the sniper's nest at the top, and he pulls out a goddamn Makarov of all things and squats down on top of the sandbags like they're a park bench or something. Here this guy is, he just woke up all of Cordon with the racket he was making, and now he's fully exposed and armed only with a pistol. I had to shoot him, he was just too stupid to live.
Last time I was up this way I thought I saw a bear.
If you found the Wish Granter and wished to find the Wish Granter, would you get trapped in an infinite loop?
I can't help but feel bad for snorks. There but for the grace of god...
Of all the horrible mutants in the Zone, I think I hate Tushkano's the most. Nibbled to death, what a way to go.
*ah-choo!*
I swore off vodka for a while. It was the most difficult 15 minutes of my life.
Ah, this damned thing. I need to get a new backpack.
See that crow up there? No, that one, to the left. Yeah, him. He's my pet. I call him Kolya.
Some view, huh?
I tried to go fishing here once. My rod melted.
Kalinka, Kalinka, hmm hmm hmm...
*yawn*
I think I sleep the best during a blowout. It's the one time when you know no one can sneak up on you.

You know the legend of the Oasis, right? It's supposedly a magical area right in the heart of the Zone that is free from radiation and anomalies, and has the power to rejuvenate a stalker. I hope to find it some day.
We should go hit 100 Rads bar later.
I swear I'm going to find a way to get that ferris wheel in Pripyat running. I'm dying to take that thing for a ride. You watch, I'll do it.
I once had to huddle up next to a decomposing Flesh for warmth one night when I couldn't start a fire. Wasn't too bad, it was like sleeping with a big, squishy teddy bear.

Me and Vasya Pipefitter used to play a game during blowouts, we would run out of cover inbetween the waves and see who could get farthest before chickening out. I saw Vasya just the other day, moaning and drooling on himself. He won.
I have yet to eat mutant meat, and I'm sure it's disgusting, but Flesh meat cooking really smells good.
I should have packed sunglasses. I always forget my sunglasses.
Ow, damn it! Stubbed my toe.
I got a rock in my shoe.
Do you hear a telephone?
What the fuck was that?
I saw a Bloodsucker trying to hump a Flesh once. You can't unsee something like that. The squeals still haunt me.
Do you think Controller's might have been human at some point? I mean, they could be aliens or demons or something, but then where did they get the pants?

One night I came up to a guy sitting at a campfire, sat down next to him and started talking. When I finally looked up I realized he was a Controller! He's just looking at me like, "what the fuck are you doing here?" Never ran so fast in my life.
You know, I have not seen one insect the whole time I've been in the Zone.
All the planning and preparation I did to find a way to sneak into the Zone, never once did it dawn on me how much more difficult it was going to be to find a way back out.
Watch out for that pile of Flesh poo.
I swear, if I ever find the Wish Granter I'm wishing for socks. That's all I keep thinking, I wish I had on a fresh pair of socks.

There are two stalkers here in the Zone that I grew up with. They were best friends, but one joined Duty and the other Freedom. Now they hate each other because they are told to. Mind control isn't just limited to emitters in the Zone.
I've seen some of the most horrific sights here in the Zone, but I've also seen incredible beauty. It's the extreme peaks and valleys that I came here for, the adventure into the transmundane.
I have to pee.
Shooting star! Ah, you missed it.
Notice you don't see many corpses lying around for too long? Eventually something comes along and eats it. Freaking Zone man, everything gets eaten.
Dancing on the ashes of the world... hmm hmm hmm...

Did you know you can tame a Pseudodog? I know a guy who did it, kept one as his pet, it was his best friend. An unsuspecting stalker shot it one day, so the guy shot him. Murdered for killing a mutant... fucking Zone, man.
Gah! Just walked into a spider web.
Wind's coming from the east now.
Ow, fucking thorn bush.
Where does a king keep his armies? Shit.. I forget how that joke ends.
I used to have a Moskvitch like the one we passed by earlier. It was in about the same condition, too.
I can feel when a blowout is about to happen. The next one is going to occur... now! ...nope... okay, now! ...wait...
I have had a headache for the past 3 days straight. I'm about to blow my brains out.
The artefacts from the Zone, side of the tracks... hmm hmm hmm...

It's hard to believe this once used to be a thriving community. I wonder if the original residents could ever have imagined the series of horrors their homes would be subjected to. Now here it stands; frozen in time as a hollowed out, forgotten memory.
Today has probably been the best day of my life. Kinda sad, if you think about it.

Have you ever seen two mutants having sex? Neither have I. The researchers say they are all sterilized from the prolonged exposure to the radiation. But think of how many have been killed, where do they keep coming from?

A friend of mine died due to the emissions put out by the Miracle Machine. Well, I like to think he is dead anyway. The sad thing is he is still alive. I saw him just the other day, eating the face off an Ecologist. This fucking place...
You know what I could go for right now? An apple. I haven't had an apple in a long time.
Do you know why squirrels swim on their backs? To keep their nuts dry.
Have you ever seen a porcupine in the Zone? I was talking to a stalker the other day and he said there aren't flowers in the Zone anymore because the porcupines trampled them all.
I heard they were researching some secret weapons programs around here.
Have you seen that prototype rifle the Monolith have? That thing is bad ass.
I'm getting hungry. What do I want to eat? Let's see... bread, diet sausage, tourist's delight... decisions, decisions.
I need more ammo. It always seems like I need more ammo. No matter how many rounds I have, I always feel like I will need one more. It scares the hell out me.
I feel like something really bad is about to happen.
What do you keep looking at?

I've heard the radiation levels inside Reactor #4 are still so high they would kill a man in thirty seconds. Shame, it would probably be pretty cool to search around inside there and see what it's like.
Everyone thinks Sidorovich is a good guy. They're all buying the act, I don't trust him. He is a rip-off artist, a con man, and a scammer. He is a fat, fat, slimy man.
I have no problem raiding someone's stash, but I never touch one at a gravesite. It's like I would be tempting fate, like I would be the next one to have a marker.
Fwww... fhwww.. I want to learn to whistle. I've never been able to do it.

There's this story I want to tell you. It's about this girl... what was her name? Anyway, she was going to... ah, where the hell was she going? Well the point is, once she got there she... damn, I forget. Anyway, you get what I'm trying to say.
You know what I want to try? Elephant meat. Never heard of anyone eating it. I'll bet it's tasty.
Do you think it would be a waste if I found the Wish Granter and I just wished for a clean, dry place to sleep? Because lately that's all I've been wishing for.
Ow, ow, fucking blister.
I'll bet you 20 RU it's going to rain all day today.

So the Oasis, it is supposed to have healing powers, if you stand in it nothing can hurt you. So if you stood in there forever, would you be immortal? Eternity spent in the same spot. You can live forever but you can never leave.
Did you know snorks like to steal clothes? I'm serious, I've seen it. Makes me think about all the times a sock went missing back home, maybe I had a snork living in my house.

I once sold an artefact to a tourist for 10,000 RU and put the money in my coat pocket. Later that day I was attacked by a snork. I fought the damn thing off but it ran away with my jacket. Somewhere out there is a snork wearing a very expensive coat.
I know I'm going to hell and I don't mind. I've already been through the Red Forest, how much worse could hell be?

I had a relative that used to live here before the 1986 disaster. Used to be a nice, quiet, peaceful community. She moved away two weeks before the accident. Pretty lucky, right? She was hit by a bus the next day. The universe is a bitch sometimes, man.
Never go back the same way you came. A wise old stalker told me that once.

I sometimes wonder if I've already found the Wish Granter and just didn't realize it. I mean, what does such a thing look like? It could look like a twig for all we know and everyone just keeps walking by it. I'll just have to start wishing at twigs.

You know what I love about the Zone? It's the kind of place you hear about, there's all these myths and legends and rumors about it, and you know half of it must be made up, and you finally get in here and realize it's all true.

Did you hear about Vadim Wirecutter? He was missing for days up in Jupiter. Someone found him in a building near the Ventillation Complex, he had starved to death. He was less than 20 meters from the entrance. How does something like that happen?

There was a stalker called Varmint who thought he had it all figured out. He found a big piece of iron to sleep on because it was nice and warm. Of course it was, it was highly irradiated. When he woke up, all of his teeth had fallen out. Always carry a Geiger counter.
I cannot get this damned splinter out for the life of me.
Give me a medkit. If something should happen to you I can use it to revive you.
You've got something stuck on your shoe.
Shit, did I lose my compass? Who the hell sells compasses around here?
I had a dream last night where we were all just children's dolls, and our lives were acted out in their imaginations. We lived in a sandbox next to a giant crystal stuck in the ground.
I learned how to shoot a rifle when I was six years old. Still trying to figure out how to hit stuff with it.

I was in a firefight a while back and something hit me on the side of the head. I'm thinking, what the hell? Did this guy just run out of ammo and now he's throwing rocks at me? I was so pissed off I threw it right back at him. Good thing I did, it was a grenade.
Ah, the Zone... Where else can you go where the leading cause of death is getting eaten by something?
Have you heard the old rookie initiation joke? Tell him to look for a stalker called Magpie. He'll be running in circles for days. It's hilarious.

Have you heard of the Death Trucks? Supposedly the Monolith gather up stalkers who fell victim to the Brain Scorcher and load them into trucks to indoctrinate them into the Monolith faction. They're called the Death Trucks because very few make it alive.
Bread and sausage, that's all I eat. I can't afford Tourist's Delight.
My last name has nothing to do with my former occupation.

I saw a deer the other day. Seriously, I did, no one believes me. Freaking Zone man, I can say I saw a mutant vampire that turns invisible or a two-headed monster capable of leaping thirty meters through the air and shredding a man to pieces, no one blinks an eye. But say you saw a deer around here and you might as well be talking about Bigfoot.
I came to the Zone to be alone. I never imagined how lonely it could get.
The best advice I can give any stalker is; don't piss on an electro anomaly. Trust me.

Have you heard of Alexey Printmaker? He was legendary as a literal artefact magnet. He could just stand in an anomaly field with his detector out, wait a little while, and eventually an artefact would move close enough to him for him to pick it up. No one knows how he gained this power, but it seemed to keep getting stronger as time went on. You'd think the guy was pretty lucky, right? He was killed when a Jellyfish shot out at him with enough force to embed itself inside his cranium.

I was watching a couple of Flesh running around in a field the other day. They weren't threatening anyone, just seemed to be having a good time. A Bandit came along and started watching them too. After a while, for no reason, he pulled out his rifle and shot one of them. He smirked, apparently satisfied he could still hit the broad side of a barn, and turned and walked away. Well, the other Flesh wasn't letting that shit pass, it ran right up to him and headbutted him into an anomaly. Zone karma.

I was talking to Roma Antfarmer the other day, and I noticed he was carrying a grenade. He said he always carries a grenade incase he gets attacked by a Chimera. When I asked him how he planned on killing a Chimera with a grenade, he told me the grenade wasn't for the Chimera, it was for him. He figures it would be a less painful death.
First time I encountered a Whirligig I blundered right into it. I managed to fight my way out of it before it detonated but it sucked off all my clothes. That was a cold night.
Have you ever seen the way the sky looks after a blowout? One of the rare times something beautiful results from something horrific.
You know you're hungry when Bloodsucker meat starts looking good.
I've heard rumors of some weird experiments that were being conducted in the Zone. I wonder what was going on here.
These blowouts need to end. The Zone conjures them up at its will and we all scurry for cover like mice. It's like we're not even human anymore.

I heard there was some weird shit going on in Limansk. Anatoli Boarkiller was telling me a story about a guy there that built a teleport machine in his basement. It supposedly worked, and it successfully de-materialized him. Trouble is, he never built one on the other side to put him back together. God only knows where he is now.
